fxInfo_label: HOG removal by legislature in practice
fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: The question refers to whether the legislature (or either of its chambers) is considered to hold this power of removal in practice, regardless of whether this is regulated by law and whether this power has been exercised or not. Moreover, the question refers to removal other than through an impeachment process.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: If the legislature, or either chamber of the legislature, took actions to remove the head of government from office, would it be likely to succeed even without having to level accusations of unlawful activity and without the involvement of any other agency?

fxInfo_responses.value: No, unlikely, but there is a chance it would happen.
Yes, probably, but there is a chance it would fail.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2exremhog, *_osp, *_ord
